title: Configure password policy in IdM Admin Portal
content:
The suite admin can go to the IdM Admin Portal of the suite to configure password policies for users of the DB type. These users are stored in the IdM database and have the following settings defined in Suite Administration and the IdM Admin Portal. 

Suite Administration IdM Admin Portal
Account users
  • Role: Account user
  • Authentication type: DB
 Type: REGULAR
Integration users
  • Role: Integration user
  • Authentication type: DB
 Type: SYSTEM

Add and edit a password policy

You can customize the default password policy for your organization, and add more password policy configurations. For example, you can define a password policy only for integration users or for account users, or a specific user, as described below. 

  1. In the tenant detail page from Suite Administration, click the IdM settings tab to open the IdM Admin Portal. 
  2. Click Password Policy.  
  3. Click    to add a password policy. 
  4. Configure the following fields of the policy, and then click SAVE.
    Setting Description Recommended value
    Name The password policy name
    Default For Select the type of users to whom the password policy configuration is applied.
    • For account users, select REGULAR.
    • For integration users, select SYSTEM.
    • You can also leave this field empty and then set this policy for a specific user. To do this,  go to the Users tab, click a user name, and then click the    action button to change the password policy of the user.
    Lockout Threshold The maximum number of invalid password attempts before a lockout.  5
    Lockout Duration The duration of a lockout (in minutes). By default, it's 90 minutes. 90
    Idle Day The number of days that a user can be Idle before being prompted to change their password. After users reach the idle days, they must change their password. The unit is days.  90
    Max Unlock Threshold The maximum number of times of auto-unlocking the user. Once exceeding the max unlock threshold, the user is locked permanently until an administrator manually unlocks this user.   2
    Expiration Check

    Enables expiration check for passwords.

    If this setting isn't enabled, passwords won't expire.

    		 Enabled
    Expiration Duration The maximum days before a password is expired. The unit is days. 90
    Min Length The minimum length of a password. 10
    Max Length The maximum length of a password. 16
    Upper And LowerCase A password must contain both upper and lower case letters. Enabled
    Numerical A password must contain at least one numeric character. Enabled
    Special Character A password must contain at least one of the following special characters: all characters except alphabet characters, numbers, and “-“. Enabled
    History Check The last 10 historical passwords aren't allowed to be used for the new password.  Enabled
    Info Sensitive

    Whether the user's attribute values are allowed to be used as a password.

    When you check Info Sensitive, users aren't allowed to use their attribute as a password. 

    		 Enabled
    Important 
    If you set a password policy weaker than the recommendations, you are disabling or bypassing security features, thereby exposing the system to increased security risks. By using this password policy, you understand and agree to assume all associated risks and hold OpenText harmless for the same.

    To edit or delete an existing password policy, select the policy from the list and then click the Edit (Pencil) or Delete (dustbin) icon.

Password policy behavior

For REGULAR users:

  • Out of the box, a default password policy (named DefaultPolicy) is applied.
  • If a user is assigned a password policy directly, that policy is applied.
  • If a user isn't assigned a password policy and there's a defaultFor=REGULAR password policy defined, this password policy is applied.

For SYSTEM users:

  • Out of the box, the passwords of integration users created in Suite Administration will never expire. 
  • If a user is assigned a password policy directly, that policy is applied. 
  • If a user isn't assigned a password policy and there's a defaultFor=SYSTEM password policy defined, this password policy is applied.
